features: STYLISH FLOOR CABINET: Features a sleek gray finish with double doors and brass pull hardware for an elevated and stylish addition to your space
AMPLE STORAGE: Interior adjustable shelf and top drawer provide ample storage, and its versatile design can be used in the bathroom, living room, or in any room around the home
MADE WITH DURABLE ENGINEERED WOOD: Constructed from durable MDF that is easy to maintain and clean to provide long-lasting style and organization
EASY ASSEMBLY: Easy-to-follow step-by-step instructions and all of the hardware needed for installation are included for quick assembly so you can start using it right away
EFFICIENT SIZE: Measures 13" x 26" x 33.6" to provide efficient storage, and it can be purchased alone or with other items from the Mercer collection for a cohesive look
body.description: Upgrade your home storage while adding mid-century modern decor with the Teamson Home Mercer Mid Century Modern Wooden Floor Cabinet. This decorative cabinet features a gray finish with double doors and brass pulls for an elevated and stylish addition to your space. The interior adjustable shelf and top drawer provide ample storage and help to reduce clutter, and its versatile design can be used in the bathroom, living room, or in any room around the home. Constructed from durable engineered wood, this floor cabinet is built to provide you with long-lasting organization. Easy, step-by-step instructions and all of the hardware needed for installation are included for quick assembly. Purchase this stylish cabinet alone or with other items from the Mercer collection for a cohesive, updated look. The Teamson Home Mercer Wooden Floor Cabinet with Drawer and 2 Doors measures 13" x 26" x 33.6" to provide accessible storage without taking up too much space in your living area or bathroom.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super high quality, great choice for the price
reviews.reviewText: I love this cabinet, it's amazing for storing my clothes since they were always just laying on the ground before. I ended up getting two of these because of how good they were, the setup took less than 15 mins, just your standard setup with a few bolts and screws. The magnetic hold is pretty good when you close the door, meaning that they won't just open up randomly. Neither one of my cabinets came with instructions, but it was very easy to figure out anyways. Overall, amazing storage, perfect for storing clothes, or using as a taller nightstand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for storage
reviews.reviewText: I like the look of this small cabinet and I like the grey color. It's great for storing things and looks nice. I tried to assemble it together and it was difficult doing it alone. Once someone else came home, it was much easier with two people, so one could hold things in place. Overall, a nice, inexpensive pieces of storage furnirure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I actually bought this and returned it it was quite expensive for the quality and the one that I put together was very broken so I didn't even open the 2nd 1.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Nice looking, but overall quality is poor.
reviews.reviewText: I like that it's a nice looking unit, was fairly easy to assemble, and was only missing a few screws for the back. I don't like that the front doors are misaligned, the drawer slide doesn't work well (drawer keeps coming off the rollers), and that the materials are so cheap. The drawer also rubs against the frame, which will cause premature paint wear.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Looks nice, but not even close to worth $200
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Once it's all put together, it looks nice & holds a good amount, but...The directions are horrible. Damaged areas were very evident all over- dings in the wood & missing/scratched paint. Missing (2) screws to attach the backing. Drawer doesn't want to open completely & opens crooked, & when you go to open it further it wants to fall out (see included video). The drawer is too small to even fit pillowcases well. The drawer bottom is very thin so don't put anything heavy in it. The doors touch when closing/opening them (& yes, I put it together correctly) & this will eventually cause the paint to scrape off.For a $50 to $80 cabinet, sure I could overlook most of these errors. But for $200- come on! Give me a cabinet that's worth the extra money

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cabinet in gray on feet w/ dark brass hardware. Built it yourself. Love it. Sturdy
reviews.reviewText: This is the perfect medium slate gray color. It’s a project for sure, and it’s in a million flat pieces and you need to do a DIY on your own to assemble it.Once together it’s pretty sturdy and straight and not janky at all.The sides and shelves and whatnot are all very thick and sturdy.The drawer pulls out smoothly and there are two shelves that fit a surprising amount of stuff on the inside main part of the cabinet.It took maybe an hour to assemble and I was able to do it all my myself (adult female). I used a standard power drill to help with the process in combination with the small little flat pack hand tools provided.The hardware is a dark brass sort of shade that’s like an antiqued gold color.I like that it’s on it’s own little feet so that it isn’t a built in cabinet and you can move it around as needed or use it in different places as you move things around the house.I currently have it in my bathroom to hold my excessive amount of hair and bath products and such, but I may also use it later on in a hallway area for shoes and winter gear later on. I like that it’s versatile enough to work in different ways around the house as you need it for whatever you need to organize.Overall I’d recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice Sturdy Free Standing Cabinet
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Pros: - Teamson Home Mercer Free Standing Cabinet - Gray - Easy to assemble (took me about an hr w/ filming etc) ○ Simple pictoral instructions - Nice & Sturdy - Made of Durable MDF (except drawer bottom & back of cabinet) - Cabinet measures 13" deep x 26" wide x 33.6" tall ○ Pull out drawer on top (measures 6.3" tall x 21.3" long) ○ Double door w/ 2 shelves (21.6" tall x 21.3" long) § Shelf is adjustable ○ Bottom of cabinet sits off the floor 3.74" (leg height) - Nice dark brass hardware (door pull & cabinet pulls) - Variety of uses (bathroom, bedroom, living room, sitting room, entry way)Cons: - Only real issue is MDF - easily scratches/scuffs/chipsI ordered this to have extra storage in my house. I was thinking of using it our laundry room to store our extra bottles of laundry detergent, softner, etc but I might end up using it in the living room to store board games, puzzles etc that the kids frequently use to keep them nice and hidden and organized. The cabinet was pretty easy to put together. It took me about an hour and that was stopping to record and video steps along the way. The gray is a nice neutral color and will go with just about anything. The price point seems to have increased since I ordered this item but still feel that it is a fair price from what you get. I would recommend this product to others.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a piece of pressboard junk! Don’t waste your money!!!
